Laboratory for Computational Social Systems (LCS2) is a research group led by Dr. Tanmoy Chakraborty and Dr. Md. Shad Akhtar at Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology, Delhi (IIIT-Delhi). Broad research interests of this group include Data Mining, Complex Networks, Social Computing, Natural Language Processing and Data-driven Cybersecurity.

ACSS 2020: Workshop on AI for Computational Social Systems.

News

  • January 14, 2020
    LCS2, IIITD was in news for conducting Workshop on Combating Fraud Activities using Data Science covered by ETV Bharat.
  • December 24, 2019
    Tanmoy Chakraborty received Outstanding reviewer recognition in EMNLP-IJCNLP, 2019.
  • December 24, 2019
    Tanmoy Chakraborty received ASEM-DUO India Faculty Fellowship.
  • December 15, 2019
    Paper accepted at ECIR 2020: Prajna Upadhyay, Srikanta Bedathur, Tanmoy Chakraborty, Maya Ramanath. Aspect-based Academic Search using Domain-specific KB, European Conference on Information Retrieval (ECIR), 2020.
  • December 10, 2019
    Paper accepted at AAAI 2020: Shivangi Singhal, Anubha Kabra, Mohit Sharma, Rajiv Shah, Tanmoy Chakraborty, Ponnurangam Kumaraguru. SpotFake+: A Multimodal Framework for Fake News Detection via Transfer Learning, 34rd AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI), 2020(Student Abstract).
  • December 10, 2019
    Paper accepted at AAAI 2020: Sarthak Jindal, Raghav Sood, Richa Singh, Mayank Vatsa, Tanmoy Chakraborty. NewsBag: A Benchmark Multimodal Dataset for Fake News Detection, SafeAI workshop, AAAI, 2020.
  • December 09, 2019
    Hridoy Sankar Dutta won third prize in the IDRBT Doctoral Colloquium 2019.
  • December 03, 2019
    Brihi Joshi got selected to attend the AAAI Undergraduate Consortium to be held at AAAI 2020 (acceptance rate - 16%) on 7th of February, 2020 in New York.
